data.going: ABANDONED - Gales (Day of Racing) Racing Abandoned. To protect yourself and others please do not travel and call NHS 111 (GB) or HSE 112 (Republic of Ireland) for expert advice. Colour bag drop off is located on the outside of the building under cover. Stable staff / horsebox drivers facilities on ground floor. Testing stations will open 5 hours prior to the 1st race. There is one at the entrance to the horsebox park and 2 on the main drive. Food & drinks available on site

data.other: The screening station for horseboxes will be in the Horsebox Field. On completion, please park and unload there. If you require help in unloading horses or carrying equipment, please call Lizzie on 07528 546596 and one or her stables team will be happy to come and help. Trainers and Jockeys screening will be on the Main Drive, and on completion will turn right and park on Hill and Stream overlooking the Parade Ring. Owners screening will be on the Main Drive, and on completion will turn left and park on the Run In Rail. All participants will recieve a voucher to be redeemed with Furness Fish and Game for sandwiches or a made up platter. Picnics are allowed at your vehicle.

data.other: **New Parade Ring Arrangements** There will be 1 single entrance/exit to the Parade Ring, via the woodchip horsewalk from the stables/trackside. We have closed the grandstand side pedestrian gate to be able to offer larger spectator/owner viewing; everyone is asked to follow the horsewalk to enter/exit this area. Stables Testing Station will continue to have a relief lane to ease vehicle congestion on the horsewalk. All horseboxes will be asked to hold momentarily during peak horse movement between races. Tier 3 Update - Following the news that Wincanton Racecourse is in a Tier 3 area of England, we will race behind closed doors with amendments to Owner arrangements. Males Jockeys changing is in the Paddock Marquee, Females within the usual weighing room area. Jockeys will have access to their usual catering offer.
